summary: Completed testing of paragraph stopwatch feature. All 6 features tested and verified working correctly. The stopwatch appears in 'LEYENDO AHORA' mode, shows MM:SS format with estimated time, resets on paragraph change, stops when paused, and changes to red when overtime.
passed_tests: Stopwatch appears only when paragraph is in 'LEYENDO AHORA' mode and timer is running
Stopwatch shows estimated time alongside elapsed time (e.g., 0:02 / 3:06)
Stopwatch resets to 0:00 when clicking 'Siguiente Párrafo'
Stopwatch digits change to red (text-red-200) when elapsed time exceeds estimated time (isOverTime)
Stopwatch background changes to red (bg-red-500/30) when overtime
Stopwatch font becomes bold when overtime
Stopwatch stops/hides when main timer is paused
Timer icon (lucide Timer) displays next to stopwatch

stopwatch_visibility.details: Stopwatch only appears when isCurrentParagraph && isTimerRunning. Hidden when paused or not current paragraph.

stopwatch_format.details: Format is MM:SS (e.g., 0:02, 0:05). Uses formatParagraphTime() function.

estimated_time_display.details: Shows '/ 3:06' format next to elapsed time. Uses paragraphTimes.adjustedDuration or paragraph.total_time_seconds.

stopwatch_reset.details: Stopwatch resets to 0 when paragraph changes. Verified by clicking 'Siguiente Párrafo' - new paragraph starts at 0:02.

overtime_color_change.details: When paragraphElapsed > estimatedTime: bg-red-500/30 background, text-red-200 color, font-bold. Verified with temporary test code.

pause_behavior.details: Stopwatch hidden when timer is paused (isTimerRunning = false). 'LEYENDO AHORA' indicator also disappears.

critical_code_review_comments: Code implementation is clean and follows React best practices
useEffect cleanup properly clears interval on unmount
Conditional styling with Tailwind classes works correctly for overtime state
context_for_next_testing_agent: Paragraph stopwatch feature fully implemented and tested. The stopwatch uses paragraphElapsed state with setInterval (1 second). Overtime detection uses isOverTime = paragraphElapsed > estimatedTime. CSS classes for overtime: bg-red-500/30, text-red-200, font-bold. For testing overtime without waiting, temporarily modify line 35 to use a short test time (e.g., 3 seconds).
